ContributingÔÉÅ

Thank you for your interest in contributing to forex_data! This guide will help you get started.

Getting StartedÔÉÅ

Development SetupÔÉÅ

  1. Fork the repository on GitHub

  2. Clone your fork:

    git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/forex_data.git
cd forex_data

  3. Install Poetry if you haven‚Äôt already:

    curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -

  4. Install dependencies:

    poetry install --with dev

  5. Create a branch for your changes:

    git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name

Code StandardsÔÉÅ

Python Style GuideÔÉÅ

This project follows PEP 8 style guidelines with some modifications:

  • Use type hints for all function parameters and return values

  • Maximum line length: 88 characters (Black formatter default)

  • Use single quotes for strings unless double quotes avoid escaping

  • Docstrings should follow Google style

Linting and FormattingÔÉÅ

The project uses several tools to maintain code quality:

Flake8 - Linting:

poetry run flake8 forex_data/

MyPy - Type checking:

poetry run mypy forex_data/

Configuration files are available:

  • setup.cfg - Flake8 configuration

  • mypy.ini - Standard MyPy configuration

  • mypy_relaxed.ini - Relaxed settings for initial development

Running all checks:

poetry run flake8 forex_data/
poetry run mypy --config-file=mypy.ini forex_data/

TestingÔÉÅ

Writing TestsÔÉÅ

  • All new features should include tests

  • Tests should be placed in the tests/ directory

  • Use descriptive test names that explain what is being tested

  • Follow the existing test structure

Running TestsÔÉÅ

Run the full test suite:

poetry run pytest

Run specific test files:

poetry run pytest tests/test_hist_data_manager.py

Run with coverage:

poetry run pytest --cov=forex_data --cov-report=html

Test with different engines:

# Configure in appconfig.yaml
ENGINE: polars  # Test with Polars
ENGINE: pandas  # Test with Pandas
ENGINE: pyarrow # Test with PyArrow

Continuous IntegrationÔÉÅ

The project uses CircleCI for continuous integration. All PRs must:

  • ‚úÖ Pass all tests

  • ‚úÖ Pass linting checks

  • ‚úÖ Pass type checking

  • ‚úÖ Maintain or improve code coverage

See .circleci/config.yml for CI configuration.

DocumentationÔÉÅ

Building DocumentationÔÉÅ

Documentation is built using Sphinx. To build locally:

cd docs
poetry run sphinx-build -b html source build/html

View the built documentation:

open build/html/index.html  # macOS
xdg-open build/html/index.html  # Linux
start build/html/index.html  # Windows

Docstring FormatÔÉÅ

Use Google-style docstrings:

def get_data(self, timeframe: str, start: str, end: str) -> DataFrame:
    """Retrieve OHLC data for specified timeframe and date range.

    Args:
        timeframe: The timeframe for candles (e.g., '1h', '1D', '1W')
        start: Start date in format 'YYYY-MM-DD' or 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'
        end: End date in format 'YYYY-MM-DD' or 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'

    Returns:
        DataFrame containing OHLC data with columns: timestamp, open,
        high, low, close

    Raises:
        ValueError: If timeframe is not supported
        FileNotFoundError: If data files are not found

    Example:
    >>> manager = HistoricalManagerDB(config='data_config.yaml')
    >>> data = manager.get_data(ticker='EURUSD', timeframe='1h', start='2020-01-01', end='2020-01-31')
    """
    pass

Adding Documentation PagesÔÉÅ

To add a new documentation page:

  1. Create a .rst file in docs/source/

  2. Add the file to the appropriate toctree in index.rst

  3. Build and verify the documentation

Contribution WorkflowÔÉÅ

Making ChangesÔÉÅ

  1. Make your changes in your feature branch

  2. Add tests for new functionality

  3. Update documentation if needed

  4. Run tests and linting:

    poetry run pytest
poetry run flake8 forex_data/
poetry run mypy forex_data/

  5. Commit your changes:

    git add .
git commit -m "Add feature: brief description"

    Use clear, descriptive commit messages:

    • Add feature: support for new data provider

    • Fix bug: incorrect timeframe conversion

    • Docs: update installation instructions

    • Test: add tests for real-time manager

  6. Push to your fork:

    git push origin feature/your-feature-name

Submitting a Pull RequestÔÉÅ

  1. Go to the forex_data repository

  2. Click ‚ÄúNew Pull Request‚Äù

  3. Select your fork and branch

  4. Fill in the PR template with:

    • Description of changes

    • Motivation for the changes

    • Testing performed

    • Related issue numbers (if applicable)

  5. Submit the PR

Your PR will be reviewed and may receive feedback for changes before merging.

What to ContributeÔÉÅ

We welcome contributions in many areas:

FeaturesÔÉÅ

  • üîå New data source integrations

  • üìä Additional timeframe support

  • üé® Enhanced plotting capabilities

  • ‚ö° Performance optimizations

  • üóÑÔ∏è Database backends (PostgreSQL, DuckDB, etc.)

Bug FixesÔÉÅ

  • üêõ Fix reported issues

  • üîß Improve error handling

  • üìù Correct documentation errors

DocumentationÔÉÅ

  • üìö Improve existing docs

  • ‚úçÔ∏è Add examples and tutorials

  • üåç Translations (future)

TestsÔÉÅ

  • ‚úÖ Improve test coverage

  • üß™ Add edge case tests

  • üéØ Integration tests

Development PrioritiesÔÉÅ

Current Focus AreasÔÉÅ

Based on the project roadmap, priority areas include:

  1. Database Integration

    • PostgreSQL support

    • DuckDB integration

    • Arrow Flight SQL server

  2. Enhanced Real-time Manager

    • Automatic failover between providers

    • Smart API call distribution

    • Rate limit management

  3. Improved Charting

    • More chart types

    • Technical indicators

    • Interactive features

  4. Performance

    • Benchmark additions

    • Optimization opportunities

    • Memory efficiency

See README.md under ‚ÄúFuture developments‚Äù for more details.

Code Review ProcessÔÉÅ

What Reviewers Look ForÔÉÅ

When reviewing your PR, maintainers will check:

  • ‚úÖ Code quality: Follows style guide, well-structured

  • ‚úÖ Tests: Adequate test coverage, tests pass

  • ‚úÖ Documentation: Changes are documented

  • ‚úÖ Type hints: Proper type annotations

  • ‚úÖ Performance: No performance regressions

  • ‚úÖ Compatibility: Works with all engines (Polars, Pandas, PyArrow)

Getting HelpÔÉÅ

Need help with your contribution?

  • üí¨ Open a discussion on GitHub Discussions (if available)

  • üêõ Reference related issues

  • üìß Contact maintainers through GitHub

Community GuidelinesÔÉÅ

Be RespectfulÔÉÅ

  • Treat everyone with respect

  • Welcome newcomers

  • Be patient and helpful

  • Focus on constructive feedback

Code of ConductÔÉÅ

This project adheres to professional standards:

  • Use welcoming and inclusive language

  • Respect differing viewpoints

  • Accept constructive criticism gracefully

  • Focus on what‚Äôs best for the community

LicenseÔÉÅ

By contributing to forex_data, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under the same license as the project (see LICENSE file).

RecognitionÔÉÅ

Contributors will be:

  • Listed in the project contributors

  • Acknowledged in release notes for significant contributions

  • Appreciated for making forex_data better! üéâ

Thank You!ÔÉÅ

Every contribution, no matter how small, makes forex_data better. We appreciate your time and effort in improving this project!

Note

Questions about contributing? Open an issue with the ‚Äúquestion‚Äù label!
